title: Authentication in Serverless
content: Custom authentication is not available in Serverless deployments. Use Single Sign-On (SSO) with your identity provider instead. Serverless manages all authentication through your organization's IdP.
content_snippet: Custom authentication not available in Serverless. Use SSO with your identity provider.

title: SSO Configuration for Serverless
content: Configure SSO authentication in Serverless by connecting your SAML 2.0 or OpenID Connect identity provider in the Cloud console. All user management flows through your IdP.
content_snippet: Configure SSO in Serverless via Cloud console with SAML 2.0 or OIDC.

title: User Management in Serverless
content: Direct user creation is not supported in Serverless. Manage users through your organization's identity provider. User permissions sync automatically from IdP group memberships.
content_snippet: Direct user creation not supported in Serverless. Use your organization's IdP.

title: Role-Based Access in Serverless
content: Configure roles and permissions through the Serverless console. Roles sync automatically with your SSO provider groups. Custom roles can be mapped to IdP groups.
content_snippet: Configure roles in Serverless console. Roles sync with SSO provider groups.

title: API Keys in Serverless
content: Create API keys for programmatic access to your Serverless project. API keys inherit permissions from the creating user. This is the recommended way for service authentication.
content_snippet: Create API keys for programmatic Serverless access. Keys inherit user permissions.

title: Custom Authentication in Cloud
content: Configure custom users in Elastic Cloud using the native realm. Create users via Kibana or the security API. Cloud supports both native users and federated identity.
content_snippet: Configure custom users in Cloud via native realm using Kibana or security API.

title: User Creation in Cloud
content: Create local users in your Cloud deployment. Navigate to Stack Management > Security > Users to add new users with custom roles and permissions.
content_snippet: Create users in Cloud via Stack Management > Security > Users.

title: SSO Options in Cloud
content: Cloud supports both native users and SSO. Enable SSO through deployment settings while maintaining native user support for administrative accounts.
content_snippet: Cloud supports native users and SSO simultaneously.

title: Custom Roles in Cloud
content: Define custom roles with fine-grained permissions. Cloud supports all native Elasticsearch role configurations including index and cluster privileges.
content_snippet: Define custom roles with fine-grained permissions in Cloud.

title: LDAP Integration in Cloud
content: Connect your LDAP directory to Cloud deployments for enterprise authentication. Supports Active Directory and OpenLDAP with user and group synchronization.
content_snippet: Connect LDAP/Active Directory to Cloud for enterprise auth.

title: User Management Self-Hosted
content: Full control over authentication in self-hosted deployments. Configure multiple realms including native, LDAP, PKI, and SAML. Each realm can have different priority.
content_snippet: Full auth control in self-hosted: native, LDAP, PKI, SAML realms.

title: Native Realm Configuration
content: The native realm stores users in a dedicated Elasticsearch index. Enable with xpack.security.authc.realms.native settings in elasticsearch.yml.
content_snippet: Native realm stores users in ES index. Configure in elasticsearch.yml.

title: LDAP Authentication
content: Connect to enterprise LDAP directories. Configure bind DN, user search base, and group mappings in elasticsearch.yml for seamless directory integration.
content_snippet: Connect LDAP: configure bind DN, user search base, group mappings.

title: PKI Certificate Auth
content: Authenticate users via client certificates. Configure PKI realm with truststore and certificate chain validation for mutual TLS authentication.
content_snippet: PKI auth via client certs with truststore and chain validation.

title: Custom Realm Development
content: Develop custom authentication realms by extending the Elasticsearch security plugin. Full API access for custom auth flows and integration with proprietary systems.
content_snippet: Develop custom auth realms by extending security plugin.
